page.title: 17LANGLEYBURY COMP'VE SCHOOL
page.content: In July 1985 a senior teacher, Mrs Weller, retired from the school having begun her career when the school opened after the last war. In an interview with pupils she spoke about her career at the school. When it opened all children were taught in the Mansion. There were 11 teachers and classes were small. Today there are over 50 staff and classes in the lower years average 25. The children thought the Mansion felt spooky in the early days, and it was heated by open fires. Mrs Weller had only given 2 detentions - she preferred to sort problems out for herself! She recounted various stories and is now, in her retirement, looking back over 21 years of teaching English at Langleybury. In 1985 the Leggatts School closed and the site became an annexe of Langleybury School.
